unnormalised: **New Wheels Galore: The Auto Scene is Buzzing!**
normalised: new wheels galore the auto scene is buzzing

unnormalised: Folks, buckle up! The automotive world is firing on all cylinders. Mahindra just unveiled its new Thar variant near Nashik, promising a rugged ride for those weekend getaways to Lonavala. Word is, it's got some serious off-roading capabilities, enough to tackle even the roughest patches near the Himalayas, hopefully better than last year's model.
normalised: folks, buckle up! the automotive world is firing on all cylinders. Mahindra just unveiled its new Thar variant near Nashik, promising a rugged ride for those weekend getaways to Lonavala. word is, it's got some serious off-roading capabilities, enough to tackle even the roughest patches near the Himalayas, hopefully better than last year's model.

unnormalised: Tata Motors isn't sleeping either! They're teasing a sneak peek of their upcoming electric SUV, speculated to have a range of over 500 km. Dr. Sharma from IIT Madras called it a potential game-changer for the Indian EV market.
normalised: Tata Motors isn't sleeping either! they're teasing a sneak peek of their upcoming electric S U V, speculated to have a range of over five hundred kilometer. doctor Sharma from I I T Madras called it a potential game-changer for the Indian E V market.

unnormalised: Plus, Maruti Suzuki launched a limited-edition WagonR, decked out with fancy new interiors. Starting at Rs. 6.5 Lakhs, it's targeted at young families. Apparently, the new WagonR's showroom is 2000 sq ft bigger than their old one! With all these launches, your next ride might just be around the corner. Time to start saving those Rupees!
normalised: plus, Maruti Suzuki launched a limited-edition WagonR, decked out with fancy new interiors. starting at rupee six point five lakh, it's targeted at young families. apparently, the new WagonR's showroom is two thousand square feet bigger than their old one! with all these launches, your next ride might just be around the corner. time to start saving those rupees!
